result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney (Atty Kirk Everson)

NOT ON THE RECORD 

Defendant JOHN W SCHOONOVER Jr. in court.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Court asks Atty Kirk Everson to meet with the defendant and his brother to see if he would want to take the cases as a court appointment. Atty Everson makes statement - both defendant are willing to sign a waiver but a conflict may or may not come up at some time in the cases. Court will appoint Atty Kirk Everson. Court sets for Return Date on October 3, 2022 at 10:30 AM. Court informs the defendants to stay in touch with Atty Everson.

Statement by the Court - question if he does or does not qualify. Statement by the defendant, is employed. Court will appoint a court appointed attorney. 

Court adjourned at 10:16 AM

Court sets for Status Hearing on July 12, 2022 at 8:45 AM

Court goes over right to counsel and how to obtain one. Court sets for Status of Counsel on June 21, 2022 at 10:00 AM.

Second appearance on May 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Def's brother called and stated he and his brother missed their court dates this week. Def's brother stated he looked at the notice of hearing wrong and thought it was a different date. I confirmed their address and phone number and gave them a court date of May 24, 2022 at 10:00 AM. I did ask to speak to the def to verify he was aware of the court date. Contact was made and def stated he'd also be able to make the new court date. Defendants stated they were still in the process of seeking counsel and believed they qualified for the public defender.

12:08 PM Defendant JOHN W SCHOONOVER Jr. not in court.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 22CM26 and 22CM25. Court orders a warrant - stayed for two week.

Court adjourned at 12:09 AM.

10:13 AM Defendant JOHN W SCHOONOVER Jr. in court.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant states he is still looking for an attorney. Court sets status of counsel for May 3, 2022 at 11:30 AM.

9:19 AM Defendant JOHN W SCHOONOVER Jr. appeared in court, Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and requests reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court finds probable cause. Court instructs the defendant of his/her right to an attorney. Court determines defendant stands mute and enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant. Court sets Status of Counsel March 23, 2022 at 9:00 AM. Court enters NOT GUILTY plea on the FO cases. DA Laspisa makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $500 signature bond and conditions of: Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department. 

Court adjourned at 9:22 AM.
